results.title: 64,000,000 years ago
results.creator_credit: Bill Maylone, George Johnson, John Taylor, National Film Board of Canada and Pacific Films
results.brief_description: This short animated film for children looks at the last of the great dinosaurs to stalk the central plains of North America. Lifelike models of ornithomimus, edmontosaur, and triceratops recreate the late Cretaceous period, offering a view of how our world may have looked 64,000,000 years ago. The soundtrack is filled with growls and roars with the occassional voice-over narration.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Maylone, George Johnson, John Taylor, National Film Board of Canada and Pacific Films

results.title: Dog watch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales of Pluto”.
Pluto, the faithful sea dog, is given responsibility of looking after the ship while the crew goes on shore leave. All goes well until a very crafty, very hungry, wharf rat sneaks on board.

results.title: Marusska and Wolf Castle
results.creator_credit: Edgar Dutka, Vlasta Pospislova, Miroslav Kubricht, BFA Films and Video, Kratky Film and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of the traditional Moravian tale of Marusska, a poor mountain girl, who dares to enter a haunted wolf castle and subsequently suffers the curse of the she-wolf.

results.title: The Hoffnung symphony orchestra
results.creator_credit: Harold Whitaker, John Halas, BBC-TV and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
A light hearted look at the various instruments of the orchestra, based on the original cartoons of the late Gerard Hoffung, satirising musical pomposity. The music was composed and conducted by Francis Chagrin, who collaborated with Hoffnung on many occasions.

results.title: Lakes, rivers and other water sources
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Investigates the earth’s major sources of fresh water (lakes, rivers and underground water). The origins of this water, the action of rivers, how lakes clog up, the forces that create the underground water supply and the way in which these major sources of fresh water are interconnected are also considered. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Geysers, lava & hot spots
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Uses the existence of geysers and lava flows as evidence of the heat inside the earth. Investigates the ways in which these hot spots were created and how they are different as well as looking how their energy can be harnessed by humans. Also provides a simple explanation of the formation of the earth.

results.title: Coastal dunes
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Uses an experimental approach to explain the process of saltation (sand movement) in a typical English coastal dune system. Also explains the interrelationships that exist between vegetation and soil type - the changing nature of these two elements is shown by a transect taken across a typical dune system.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International

results.title: Aspects of Central Place
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geography today: a search for order”.
This film uses the Cambridge area of the United Kingdom to discuss the applicability of Christaller’s central place theory in a modern context. Explains the forces that have given growth to the city of Cambridge and the functions of centres at different levels of the settlement hierarchy in Canmbridge. Suitable for Upper-Secondary students.

results.title: The Big green caterpillar. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Uses close-up photography to show the development of the caterpillar from the egg to the pupa and then to the butterfly stage. Narrated by Jill Taggart. Suitable for primary years prep-6.

results.title: The Best of zoom Martha
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of Martha Rudolph, a teenager suffering from epilepsy. Shows her positive outlook on life as well as her family’s reactions to her disability. Also mentions that there are degrees of epilepsy and provides a brief explanation of why epileptic fits occur.
